thag6.12:1.1: From where would anger come for one free of anger,
thag6.12:2.1: When you get angry at an angry person
thag6.12:2.2: you just make things worse for yourself.
thag6.12:2.3: When you don’t get angry at an angry person
thag6.12:2.4: you win a battle hard to win.
thag6.12:3.1: When you know that the other is angry,
thag6.12:3.2: you act for the good of both
thag6.12:3.4: if you’re mindful and stay calm.
thag6.12:5.2: reflect on the simile of the saw;
thag6.12:5.3: if craving for flavors arises in you,
thag6.12:5.4: remember the simile of the child’s flesh.
thag6.12:6.2: to sensual pleasures and future lives,
thag6.12:6.4: as one would curb a greedy cow eating corn.
